channel.title: Windows XP or Windows 7?
channel.description: Alright, so I have installed Windows 7 Ultimate, was wondering which one should be best though; Windows 7 or Windows XP?

item.title: Windows XP or Windows 7?

item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

I use to always say xp here but Microsoft no longer sells or supports xp products and such. So they don’t provie drivers for it and newer machine can’t take it. I would get 7.

item.title: Windows XP or Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @JakeP JakeP
item.description:
@JakeP wrote:

Or you can do what I do and just dual boot both XP and Win 7

That way when I feel like gaming on a system that does not need User Account Controls popping up 24/7, I reboot onto XP.

When I am just casually browsing and coding I sit on notepad++ on Win 7 (as stated before, easier to manage)

Just my preferences.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Wintercanon:

Windows 7 > Windows XP > Windows Vista.

XP > 7 > Vista. XP was fine how it was and now they force you to have this 7 bullshit pre-installed. All it is, is security updates and a new GUI and then everyone has to “rush out and buy it” because it’s the new thing.

item.title: Windows XP or Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @im0wnag3 im0wnag3
item.description:
@im0wnag3 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:20, topic:420862”][quote author=The Outsider link=topic=523535.msg3809504#msg3809504 date=1320782947]
Personally I prefer XP but the only reason I haven’t installed it on my brand new Windows 7 laptop is because I don’t feel like missing out on my graphics card capabilities because I can’t find the correct compatible driver (and that goes for every other piece of hardware installed).

Stick with 7 and save yourself some hassle.
[/quote]
When I first got the laptop, it was with XP Pro I believe, don’t quite remember. However, I feel like it’s running faster with Windows 7.

Still does the job.

I’ll take it for free if you don’t wait it, shipping fees from me.

You wouldn’t want it, it’s an Acer Notebook.[/quote]

Any chance its Acer Aspire One? i got that one and it sucks lol

item.title: Windows XP or Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

If you plan on buying a new computer, it will more than likely come with Windows 7. I’m not going to say that one is better than another, because honestly it does boil down to a matter of personal preference. However, there are pros and cons for either. I’m sure a quick google search of “Windows XP 7 performance comparison” would result in a nice list of factors that you can then take into consideration when making your purchase.

I have used both for many years, had good and bad experiences with both. But over the years, I have come to the conclusion that people will prefer whichever they use more. Some people I know started with XP, switched to 7 (new computer, work upgrade, etc), and came to detest how XP operated, and had the same thing happen with people who used 7 and switched to XP.

Read full topic
